abstract.text: A serializable description of how to sort numerics and strings.

abstract.text: A comparator that compares types according to their conformance to the comparable protocol.
A comparator that uses another sort comparator to provide the comparison of values at a key path.
An immutable description of how to order a collection of objects according to a property common to all the objects.
A comparison algorithm for a specified type.
A serializable description of how to sort numerics and strings.
Returns a Boolean value indicating whether two values are not equal.
A Boolean value that indicates whether two sort descriptors are equal.
Provides the relative ordering of two elements.
Encodes the sort descriptor into the encoder you specify.
Hashes the essential components of the comparator by feeding them into the specified hash function.
The hashed value of the comparator.
Creates a sort descriptor using a sort descriptor and a type that you specify.
Creates a sort descriptor by decoding from the decoder you specify.
The sort order that the sort descriptor uses to compare.
The orderings that you can perform sorts with.
